name: AssemblyAI
headline: APIs for AI models
description:
AssemblyAI is an applied AI company. We research, train, and deploy State-of-the-Art AI models for developers and product teams to integrate into their products/apps.

Today, we offer AI models for audio transcription, content moderation, summarization, topic detection, and many other tasks.

We are working towards building the "Stripe for AI models" - where developers and product teams will be able to easily access State-of-the-Art AI through a simple API.

We're a fully remote team of AI researchers and ML engineers, and have raised over $65M in funding from top investors including Accel, Insight Partners, Y Combinator, John/Patrick Collison, Daniel Gross, and Nat Friedman.
generated_description:
AssemblyAI is an innovative company dedicated to simplifying access to state-of-the-art AI models for developers and product teams through APIs. Founded in 2017 and part of Y Combinator's S17 cohort, the company has its roots in applied AI, where it initially focused on researching, training, and deploying advanced AI solutions.

The company's mission resonates with the ambition of becoming the "Stripe for AI models," enabling developers to easily incorporate powerful AI capabilities into their applications. Today, AssemblyAI specializes in a range of functionalities, such as audio transcription, content moderation, summarization, and topic detection.

The team, fully remote and comprising around 65 AI researchers and machine learning engineers, has successfully raised over $65 million in funding from top-tier investors including Accel, Insight Partners, Y Combinator, and prominent figures like John and Patrick Collison. Based in San Francisco, AssemblyAI is empowering both startups and established enterprises with reliable, high-performance AI models that can solve complex problems and enhance user experiences.

AssemblyAI’s product offerings include:

1. **Speech-to-Text Transcription**: Their models are known for unmatched accuracy, offering multilingual capabilities and speaker diarization.
2. **Streaming Speech-to-Text**: Ideal for real-time applications, they provide low-latency predictions for live voice interactions.
3. **Speech Understanding**: Advanced models that allow for deep analysis and insights from audio data, leveraging the latest in large language model capabilities.

The company emphasizes a developer-first approach, with comprehensive documentation, multiple SDK options, and plans to scale that address diverse customer needs. Noteworthy customers, such as CallRail and Vidyo, testify to the platform’s reliability and integration ease.

AssemblyAI is not just about transcription; it’s about transforming voice data into valuable insights and experiences. With ongoing research and development, including the recent launch of their Universal-2 model, AssemblyAI is poised at the forefront of Speech AI innovation.

For more insights and ways to get started with their technology, you can visit their website at [AssemblyAI](https://www.assemblyai.com). They invite you to test their API for free, ensuring you can experience the potential of superior speech AI firsthand.
